Package Onlinehandel.entities

Class Order

Object
Onlinehandel.entities.Order
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Order>
Direct Known Subclasses:
InterationalOrder, RegionalOrder
public abstract class Order
extends Object
implements Comparable<Order>
An order within the Onlinehandel.

An order holds information on the costumer placing the order, the items ordered and the status of the order which captures collection and delivery date and time.

The usual life cycle is
  • create an order with id, costumer and at least one item
  • add items
  • collect
  • deliver

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private DateTime collected
    The date and time when this order is collected from the sender.
    private Costumer costumer
    The costumer having plcaed this order.
    private DateTime delivered
    The date and time when this order is delivered to the recipient.
    private java.util.Set<Item> goods
    The set of items this order contains.
    private long id
    Unique id of this order.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Order​(long id, Costumer c, Iterable<Item> items)
    Constructs an order with specified id, costumer and at least one item.
    The id must be greater than 0 and the reference type arguments must be non-null.
    Order​(Order orig)
    Copies an order.
    The new order is a deep copy of the original.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean addItems​(Iterable<Item> items)
    Adds items to this order.
    Items can only be added if this order has not been collected (and not been delivered) yet.

    Only those items that are not yet added to this order are added, the rest are ignored.
    boolean addItems​(Item item)
    Adds an item to this order.
    A shipping item can only be added if this order not been collected and not been delivered yet.
    boolean collect​(DateTime toc)
    Collects this order from at a specified date and time.
    An order can only be collected if it has not been collected so far.
    If it can be collected, the specified date and time is stored in a private copy in this order.
    int compareTo​(Order arg0)
    Implements natural ordering by id for orders.
    boolean deliver​(DateTime tod)
    Delivers this order at a specified date and time.
    An order can only be delivered if it has been previously collected and not yet been delivered.
    private String ensureNonNullNonEmpty​(String str)
    Ensures that a string is non null and non empty.
    Returns the argument if it is non-null and non-empty, throws an IllegalArgumentException otherwise.
    Costumer getCostumer()
    Gets the costumer of this order.
    This getter returns a copy of the costumer held by this order.
    java.util.Set<Item> getItems()
    Gets the items of this order.
    The returned set is a copy of the private set held by this object.
    abstract int getTotal()
    Calculates the total amount (of money) to be collected at the drop off location in Euro cents.
    To be implemented in concrete subclasses.
    boolean isCollected()
    Status indicating whether the items of this order have been handed to the delivery service provider.
    boolean isDelivered()
    Status indicating whether the items of this order have been delivered to the destination by the delivery service provider.

  • Field Details

    • id

      private long id
      Unique id of this order.

    • collected

      private DateTime collected
      The date and time when this order is collected from the sender. A null value means this delivery has not been collected yet.

    • delivered

      private DateTime delivered
      The date and time when this order is delivered to the recipient. A null value means this delivery has not been delivered yet.

    • goods

      private java.util.Set<Item> goods
      The set of items this order contains.

    • costumer

      private Costumer costumer
      The costumer having plcaed this order.

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order​(long id, Costumer c, Iterable<Item> items)
      Constructs an order with specified id, costumer and at least one item.
      The id must be greater than 0 and the reference type arguments must be non-null. When invalid arguments are passed an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      id - the id to set
      c - the customer to set
      items - the items to add to this order
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when invalid arguments are passed
      Hint:
      use ensureNonNullNonEmpty(java.lang.String)

    • Order

      public Order​(Order orig)
      Copies an order.
      The new order is a deep copy of the original.
      Parameters:
      orig - the original order to be copied

  • Method Details

    • getTotal

      public abstract int getTotal()
      Calculates the total amount (of money) to be collected at the drop off location in Euro cents.
      To be implemented in concrete subclasses.
      Returns:
      the total amount of money to be collected at the drop off location in Euro cents.

    • isCollected

      public boolean isCollected()
      Status indicating whether the items of this order have been handed to the delivery service provider. True if the goods have been picked up, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the items of this order have been collected, false otherwise.

    • isDelivered

      public boolean isDelivered()
      Status indicating whether the items of this order have been delivered to the destination by the delivery service provider. True if delivered, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the items of this order have been delivered, false otherwise.

    • addItems

      public final boolean addItems​(Item item)
      Adds an item to this order.
      A shipping item can only be added if this order not been collected and not been delivered yet.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add to this order
      Returns:
      if the item could be successfully added to this order false otherwise

    • addItems

      public final boolean addItems​(Iterable<Item> items)
      Adds items to this order.
      Items can only be added if this order has not been collected (and not been delivered) yet.

      Only those items that are not yet added to this order are added, the rest are ignored.

      Parameters:
      items - the items to add to this order
      Returns:
      true if any item could be successfully added to this order

    • getItems

      public java.util.Set<Item> getItems()
      Gets the items of this order.
      The returned set is a copy of the private set held by this object. The items in the set, however are not copied.
      Returns:
      the items of this order

    • collect

      public final boolean collect​(DateTime toc)
      Collects this order from at a specified date and time.
      An order can only be collected if it has not been collected so far.
      If it can be collected, the specified date and time is stored in a private copy in this order.
      Parameters:
      toc - the date and time of collection
      Returns:
      true if this order has was successfully collected, false otherwise

    • deliver

      public final boolean deliver​(DateTime tod)
      Delivers this order at a specified date and time.
      An order can only be delivered if it has been previously collected and not yet been delivered.
      If it can be delivered, the specified date and time is stored in a private copy in this order.
      Parameters:
      tod - the date and time of delivery
      Returns:
      true if this order was successfully delivered, false otherwise

    • ensureNonNullNonEmpty

      private final String ensureNonNullNonEmpty​(String str)
      Ensures that a string is non null and non empty.
      Returns the argument if it is non-null and non-empty, throws an IllegalArgumentException otherwise.
      Parameters:
      str - the string whose non-nullity and non-emptiness is to be ensured
      Returns:
      the argument if it is non-null and non-empty
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null or empty
      Hint:
      use this method in the constructor(s)

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Order arg0)
      Implements natural ordering by id for orders.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Order>
      Hint:
      delegate to java.lang.Long.compare

    • getCostumer

      public Costumer getCostumer()
      Gets the costumer of this order.
      This getter returns a copy of the costumer held by this order.
      Returns:
      a copy of the costumer.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      creates a string representation of this delivery.
      Overrides:
